items.title: China's LandSpace hopes to complete rocket recovery in mid-2026
items.author: Eduardo Baptista

items.title: How a Silicon Valley dealmaker charmed Trump and gave Intel a lifeline
items.author: Max Cherney, Jeffrey Dastin
items.summary:
- Tan met Trump in the Oval Office, leading to a government commitment to invest billions for a near-10% stake in Intel and a reshoring narrative.
- The package included a $5.7B cash infusion and a subsequent $5B Nvidia partnership, making the U.S. government Intel’s largest shareholder.
- Intel restructured under Tan with an engineering-led culture and closer government engagement to defend against rivals like TSMC.

items.title: Italy watchdog orders Meta to halt WhatsApp terms barring rival AI chatbots
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- AGCM orders Meta to suspend WhatsApp terms that could bar rival AI chatbots as it probes potential abuse of a dominant position.
- Meta says the decision is flawed and will appeal; the probe began in July and was widened in November to cover WhatsApp Business terms.
- EU antitrust regulators are conducting a parallel inquiry, coordinating with the European Commission, amid US pushback and criticism from the Trump administration.

items.title: Waymo to update software after San Francisco power outage snarls self-driving vehicles
items.author: David Shepardson
items.summary:
- Waymo will roll fleet-wide software updates to add power-outage context and help vehicles navigate more decisively during outages.
- Emergency-response protocols and confirmation checks at dark intersections will be refined to reduce congestion and improve safety.
- Regulators are reviewing the SF incident; Waymo recently recalled software over Texas school-bus violations amid a broader probe.

items.title: Fleet management firm Motive Technologies reveals revenue growth in US IPO paperwork
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Files for a U.S. IPO on NYSE (MTVE); nine-month revenue $327.3M and net loss $138.5M through Sept 30, versus $268.9M revenue and $113.9M loss a year earlier.
- SF-based AI-powered fleet manager serving logistics, construction, energy and manufacturing; clients include Halliburton, KONE, Komatsu, NBCUniversal and Maersk; founded 2013.
- Underwriters JPMorgan, Citigroup, Jefferies and Barclays; market backdrop cites 2025 momentum tempered by tariffs, shutdown risks and AI stock selloff.

items.title: Apple to allow third-party app stores in Brazil to settle iOS case with regulator
items.author: Reuters

items.title: US judge blocks Texas app store age law meant to protect children
items.author: Mike Scarcella
items.summary:
- A federal judge blocked Texas's App Store Accountability Act, finding likely First Amendment issues and delaying its January start.
- The Computer & Communications Industry Association sued to stop the law, arguing it would curb app stores' and users' rights.
- Texas plans to appeal; the ruling reflects broader concerns about youth online safety and parental controls.

items.author: Reuters

items.title: China's LandSpace completes 'tutoring' process ahead of Shanghai IPO
items.author: Eduardo Baptista
items.summary:
- LandSpace completed the STAR Market 'tutoring' phase with regulator, guided by state-backed CICC, for a potential 2026 Shanghai listing.
- The STAR Market targets pre-profit frontier tech; LandSpace seeks funds to advance its Zhuque-3 reusable-rocket program to rival SpaceX.
- Zhuque-3's December 2025 full reusable rocket test ended in a landing crash; public funding could accelerate iteration as SpaceX reportedly planned an IPO in 2026.

items.title: Uganda restricts imports of Starlink equipment weeks before election
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Uganda restricts imports of Starlink satellite internet gear ahead of the January 15 election; many devices have already been imported despite no operating license.
- A December memo, confirmed by the Uganda Revenue Authority, requires Starlink imports to be cleared by Muhoozi Kainerugaba, Museveni’s son and military chief.
- Opponents say the move could curb information access during the vote; Uganda faced a nationwide internet shutdown in 2021, fueling censorship concerns.

items.title: Goodman Group, Canada's CPPIB strike $9.3 bln deal for Europe data centres
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Goodman Group and CPPIB sign a 50-50 A$14 billion European data-centre partnership with an initial A$3.9 billion commitment across four projects in Frankfurt, Amsterdam and Paris.
- Construction can start by 30 June 2026, with phased close expected by March 2026; CPPIB's first European data-centre partnership; Goodman also recent A$4 billion fundraise and a HK data-centre investment.
- The deal boosted Goodman's stock, rising up to 7.7% to A$31.48, the biggest gainer on the ASX 200.

items.title: US bars approvals of new models of DJI, all other foreign drones
items.author: David Shepardson
items.summary:
- The FCC adds DJI, Autel and all foreign-made drones and components to its Covered List, blocking new model approvals and critical-part imports in the U.S.
- Existing authorized models aren’t banned and current operators can keep using them; the move follows a White House review citing surveillance, data-exfiltration and supply-chain risks.
- The expansion affects other foreign makers, with potential Pentagon decisions on specific drones or classes and possible legal challenges from manufacturers.

items.title: Warner Bros bidding war and red hot M&A market has dealmakers working through holidays
items.author: Dawn Kopecki, Anousha Sakoui
items.summary: - A holiday-season M&A surge has bankers working through Christmas, with announcements around $463.6B this month and deals like Trump Media & Technology Group–TAE Technologies and IBM–Confluent. - Warner Bros. Discovery is in a bidding contest among Paramount Skydance and Netflix, while Paramount and RedBird extended their hostile bid to $108.4B with a January 21 deadline; Permira–Warburg are buying Clearwater Analytics. - Activity is broad-based with a busy pipeline; global M&A surpassed $4.8T this year, aided by low rates and post-COVID stimulus, with optimism for 2026.

items.title: China's power reforms, global data centre buildout usher in battery boom
items.author: Colleen Howe
items.summary: - China is accelerating dominance in lithium-ion energy storage cells; global shipments are up ~75% with Chinese exporters over $65B, and China now accounts for about 40% of the world's storage fleet.\n- A $35B government plan aims to nearly double capacity by 2027, supported by provincial subsidies and capacity tariffs that boost storage runtimes and profitability for data centers and renewables.\n- Analysts expect about 800 GWh of global energy-storage cell shipments next year (33-43% growth), underscoring China's leading role in the battery supply chain.

items.author: Milana Vinn

items.title: Swiss interior minister open to social media ban for children
items.author: Reuters
items.summary: Switzerland’s Interior Minister Elisabeth Baume-Schneider signaled openness to restricting social media for minors, saying she would study measures inspired by Australia’s under-16 ban and EU debates. A report will guide next steps, with options including a full ban on social platforms for children, limits on harmful content, and curbing algorithmic targeting of youth; platforms could also be held responsible for what children consume. The discussion follows a separate move by the canton of Fribourg to bar mobile phones for students until around age 15 to reduce youth device use.
